alert.note: Alert for Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 7:16PM CDT until October 04 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Creek, Mayes, Osage, Rogers, Tulsa, Wagoner and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of thunderstorms with intense rainfall. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. A quick 1 to 2 inches of rain will be possible as the line of thunderstorms moves through. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Claremore... Wagoner... Pryor... Owasso... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... Pryor Creek... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Chouteau... Inola... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
